messages.title: DO YOU REALLY WANT ANOTHER 5 YEARS OF GORDON BROWN?
messages.content: By 2014 our debt will equate to £23,000 for each of us. Do you want Gordon Brown to continue to run your economy into debt now that we get the economy back on its feet?

messages.title: DO YOU REALLY WANT A HUNG PARLIAMENT?
messages.content: The people of Oxfordshire know what a Hung Parliament was, for over 200 years until 1885 Henley was in the Commons under a coalition resulting in 13 Lib Dem costs to make progress. A Hung Parliament could leave Labour in control with the Liberals and that will mean 5 more years of Brown.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Questioning the current economic policies under Gordon Brown and implying a change is needed to get the economy back on its feet.

mentions.tacticalSituation: References to a Hung Parliament and the historical coalition of Henley which suggest strategic considerations in voting.

issues.economy: Questioning the current economic policies under Gordon Brown and implying a change is needed to get the economy back on its feet.
issues.governance: References to Henley's history of coalition under a Hung Parliament, suggesting a desire for stable governance without a coalition.

leaflet.personalStatement: Since being elected MP for the Henley Constituency two years ago I have shown the value of being a local MP rooted in the community.

politicalExperience.achievements: Rooted in the community as a local MP.

endorsements.endorsement: Support for John Howell's action in defending some of the most beautiful countryside in south Oxfordshire against inappropriate housing and energy planning.

endorsements.endorser: Kester George, Chairman, Harpsden Parish Council
endorsements.endorsement: Commendation of John Howell's frequent personal intervention, reflecting thorough understanding and common sense advice.

images.caption: Photo of John Howell working with the community.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet makes several references to local issues and specific interventions in the area, as well as questions targeted at constituents' satisfaction with the current government and views on a hung parliament.
